issue.title: Splitwise Clone
issue.body:
## Overview
Build an expense-sharing app where friends track shared expenses and settle debts.

## Features
- Google OAuth + email/password auth
- Create groups, invite members
- Add expenses, split equally
- Real-time balance calculations
- Settle up functionality
- Live updates with Socket.io

## Tech Stack
- Next.js 14 App Router
- Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
- Lucide React icons
- SQLite with better-sqlite3
- NextAuth.js
- Socket.io

## Design
- Clean minimal design, mobile-first
- Use shadcn/ui: Card, Button, Input, Avatar, Dialog

## Pages
- Landing, Login, Dashboard, Group detail, Create group

ems.task: Create project foundation: .gitignore, package.json with all dependencies (Next.js 14, Tailwind, shadcn/ui, better-sqlite3, NextAuth.js, Socket.io, lucide-react), tsconfig.json, next.config.js, and basic folder structure
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement authentication system with NextAuth.js (Google OAuth + email/password), database schema with better-sqlite3 (users, groups, expenses, settlements), API routes for auth operations, and middleware for session management

workers.task: Create database schema and initialization with better-sqlite3. Define User, Group, Expense, Settlement, Session tables with proper indexes and relationships. Initialize SQLite database and provide query helper functions.
Implement NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth and Credentials (email/password) providers. Create auth API routes and TypeScript definitions for NextAuth session.
Create authentication API endpoints for user registration and password management. Implement middleware for session validation and route protection.

ems.task: Build core backend logic: group management APIs (create, invite members), expense tracking APIs (add expenses, split equally), real-time balance calculation algorithms, settle up functionality, and Socket.io server setup for live updates

workers.task: Create database schema and SQLite storage layer with better-sqlite3 - define tables for groups, users, expenses, balances and implement all CRUD operations
Implement group management APIs - create group, invite members, list groups, get group details, and member management endpoints
Implement expense tracking APIs with equal split logic, real-time balance calculation algorithms, settle up functionality, and Socket.io server setup for live updates

ems.task: Create all UI pages using shadcn/ui components: landing page, login page, dashboard (list groups), group detail page (show expenses, balances), create group dialog, and responsive mobile-first layout with Tailwind CSS

workers.task: Create landing page and login page with authentication UI components. Files: app/page.tsx (landing), app/login/page.tsx (login), app/login/layout.tsx (login layout), components/ui/landing/hero.tsx, components/ui/landing/features.tsx, components/auth/login-form.tsx, components/auth/oauth-button.tsx. All responsive mobile-first with Tailwind and shadcn/ui Card, Button components.

Create dashboard with groups list and group detail page showing expenses/balances. Files: app/dashboard/page.tsx (dashboard layout with groups list), app/dashboard/group/[id]/page.tsx (group detail), components/dashboard/group-card.tsx, components/dashboard/expense-list.tsx, components/dashboard/balance-summary.tsx. Use shadcn/ui Card, Avatar, Badge components. Mobile-first responsive grid.

Create create group dialog and shared UI components. Files: components/create-group-dialog.tsx (main dialog), components/create-group-form.tsx (form with inputs), components/create-group-member-input.tsx (member adder), app/dashboard/layout.tsx (dashboard wrapper with header/nav), components/ui/header.tsx (responsive header), components/ui/mobile-nav.tsx (mobile navigation). Use shadcn/ui Dialog, Input, Button, Label. Responsive design with mobile drawer.

analysisSummary: Build a Splitwise clone expense-sharing app with Next.js 14, featuring Google/email authentication, group management, expense tracking, real-time balance calculations, and live updates using Socket.io.
